term_definitions.items: Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.
Tags applied to the composition. They can contain various ids, such as episode id, central case id or other types of information forming composition meta-data.
The amount or strength of a medication or substance for medication orders, administrations, dispensing etc.
The value of the amount of medication as a real number e.g 1, 1.5, 0.125.
The dose unit of this medication amount.
Free text description of the amount which may consist of the amount value and amount dose unit.
The denominator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 5mls where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The numerator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 2mg where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
Structured information about the timing (intended or actual) of administration or use of a medicine, other therapeutic good or other intervention that is given on a scheduled basis.
This is the actual or maximum number of doses or other interventions that are to be administered in a 24 hour period.
The frequency as number of times per time period that the intervention is to take place.
Specific time(s) during the day when the intervention should be applied.
The specific and repeating day(s) of the month e.g. if it is required to give a dose on the 2nd day of each month then the value is 2.
The specific and repeating day(s) of the week.
The length of time between doses or interventions. 8 Hourly is PT8H, monthly is P1M, every hour and a half is PT1H30M.
Details of variable upper and lower frequency e.g. 3-4 times a day.
Details of variable upper and lower intervals e.g. every 2-3 hours.
The upper value of the interval.
The lower value of the interval.
Information about the future or actual administration of medication.
The route by which the medication is administered (e.g. oral, sublingual etc).
A description of the site of administration.
The method of delivery if this should be specified (e.g. via a nebuliser or spacer).
The length of time over which to administer each dose (e.g. an intravenous administration may have to be over a period of 5 minutes).
Details of a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good with instructions for use.
The instructions for a particular medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good including dose and timing.
The medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good being ordered, administered to or used by the subject of care. This item should be coded if possible.
Detailed information about the ingredient(s) including form and strength.
The amount and units of the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good to be used or administered at one time.
Structured information on dose with dose unit. If 'Structured dose' is used with 'Dose description' then these must be semantically equivalent.
The timing of the doses, which may include frequency and details such as relationship to food.
A complete narrative description of how much, when and how to use the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
Details of the timing of the use or administration of the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
A condition which, when met, requires the start of administration or use.
The date and optional time to begin using the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
The date and optional time to stop using the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
The length of time for which the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good should be used or administered (from the initial dose to the final dose).
The total number of doses of the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good that are to be used or administered (from the initial dose to the final dose).
A condition which, when met, requires the cessation of administration or use.
It is anticipated that the medicine, vaccine or therapeutic good will be re-prescribed or re-dispensed over a period of time.
A reason for ordering the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
The number of times the expressed quantity of medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good may be refilled or redispensed without a new prescription.

Indicates whether or not the substitution of a prescribed medicine with a different brand name of the same medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed when the medication is dispensed/supplied.
Additional instructions to the person dispensing the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.

The timing is dependent within limits on the subject of care's condition or symptoms (e.g. 4hrly p.r.n. means the medicine can be taken as frequently as every four hours if necessary). "Pro re nata" in latin means as circumstances arise.
An identifier used in an external system and associated with this medication instruction.
Any additional information that may be needed to ensure the continuity of supply, rationale for current dose and timing, or safe and appropriate use.
Structured details of the timing of the use or administration.

The specific indication for use that is required by an authorising agency to achieve subsidy for or access to the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good. This could be a national medication scheme, insurance company or other funding agency.
Indicates the category of subsidy appropriate to the item being prescribed.
Details of the administration of the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
An additional statement on how to use the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
The amount of medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good to be dispensed.
The minimum time between repeat dispensing of the medicine, vaccine or therapeutic good. Note: This is specified by the ordering clinician for a specific reason such as safety or best practice.
A complete narrative description, with optional markup or formatting of how much, when and how to use the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
e.g. To record that the patient had been taking antibiotics three days prior to hospital admission, in the context of a 7-day course.
patient was on this treatment prior to this instruction being issued.
Generic encounter or progress note composition

items.items: Generic encounter or progress note composition
Generic encounter or progress note composition

The dose unit of this medication amount.
Free text description of the amount which may consist of the amount value and amount dose unit.
The denominator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 5mls where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
The numerator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 2mg where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.
*The amount or strength of a medication or substance for medication orders, administrations, dispensing etc.(en)
*The value of the amount of medication as a real number e.g 1, 1.5, 0.125. (en)
*The dose unit of this medication amount.(en)
*Free text description of the amount which may consist of the amount value and amount dose unit.(en)
*The denominator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 5mls where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.(en)
*The numerator value where the amount is described as a ratio e.g. 2mg where the amount is 2mg/ 5mls.(en)
Structured information about the timing (intended or actual) of administration or use of a medicine, other therapeutic good or other intervention that is given on a scheduled basis.
This is the actual or maximum number of doses or other interventions that are to be administered in a 24 hour period.
The frequency as number of times per time period that the intervention is to take place.
Specific time(s) during the day when the intervention should be applied.
The specific and repeating day(s) of the month e.g. if it is required to give a dose on the 2nd day of each month then the value is 2.
The specific and repeating day(s) of the week.
The length of time between doses or interventions. 8 Hourly is PT8H, monthly is P1M, every hour and a half is PT1H30M.
Details of variable upper and lower frequency e.g. 3-4 times a day.
Details of variable upper and lower intervals e.g. every 2-3 hours.
The upper value of the interval.
The lower value of the interval.

Strukturirana informacija o asovni opredelitvi (planirani ali dejanski) nameravane ali izvedene aktivnosti (intervencije) ki je bila planirana za izvedbo (npr. administracija ali dodelitev terapije; neka druga klinina aktivnost...)
*This is the actual or maximum number of doses or other interventions that are to be administered in a 24 hour period.(en)
*The frequency as number of times per time period that the intervention is to take place.(en)
*Specific time(s) during the day when the intervention should be applied.(en)
*The specific and repeating day(s) of the month e.g. if it is required to give a dose on the 2nd day of each month then the value is 2.(en)
*The specific and repeating day(s) of the week.(en)
*The length of time between doses or interventions. 8 Hourly is PT8H, monthly is P1M, every hour and a half is PT1H30M.(en)
*Details of variable upper and lower frequency e.g. 3-4 times a day.(en)
*Details of variable upper and lower intervals e.g. every 2-3 hours.(en)
Information about the future or actual administration of medication.
The route by which the medication is administered (e.g. oral, sublingual etc).
A description of the site of administration.
The method of delivery if this should be specified (e.g. via a nebuliser or spacer).
The length of time over which to administer each dose (e.g. an intravenous administration may have to be over a period of 5 minutes).
Vrsta apliciranja, e je doloena (npr. inhalacije, oralno...)
as trajanja ene doze apliciranega zdravila
Details of a medication administered by infusion.
The rate at which the infusion is to be administered. Use the Text choice to record non or semi-quantifiable instructions e.g. 1 drop per minute.
The formula used to calculate the Dose Administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor such as patient weight e.g. 10mg/kg/day.
The infusion carries an active pharrmaceutical ingredient.
*Details of a medication administered by infusion.(en)
*The rate at which the infusion is to be administered. Use the Text choice to record non or semi-quantifiable instructions e.g. 1 drop per minute.(en)
*The formula used to calculate the Dose Administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor such as patient weight e.g. 10mg/kg/day.(en)
*The infusion carries an active pharrmaceutical ingredient.(en)
Details of use, administration, dispensing or other care step relating to a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good which may arise from an instruction from a clinician.
The medication is planned but no execution has taken place.
The instruction has issued as an item on a prescription.
The medication has been taken by the patient for the first time.
A single administration of the medication has taken place.
The medication has been completed as instructed.
The medication has not been dispensed as supply is not yet available.
The administration of the medication has been suspended.
The medication has been re-prescribed for an existing instruction.
Reissuing of this prescription is not available without some intervention.
The planned administration has been cancelled prior to any administration.
The plan to order medication has been suspended.
The prescription has been cancelled but administration or dispensing may have occurred.
The administration of this medication has been ceased before anticipated completion.
The time to start this medication has been set.
The administration of a medication has been withheld and not given.
An administration of the medication was refused by the subject of care (patient).
The medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good which was the focus of the action. This element will normally be coded with a medicines terminology but free text may be required in some cases.

The reason(s) the specific action or step was carried out. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, rather the specific reason e.g. for administration or for ceasing the medication.
The quantity of medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
Detailed information about the ingredient(s) including form and strength.
A comment on the action taken.
The sequence number specific to the action being recorded.
Assigned by the manufacturer to identify the manufacturing batch of the item.
Details about the administration of the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good.
The name of the person to whom this was dispensed, if not the subject of care.

The number of times the medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good may still be dispensed without re-issue of a prescription or order. Note: This is the information required by the subject of care and prescriber.
Any instructions given to the subject of care or carer at the time of the action.
A dispensed medication is returned or not collected without use.
A different brand of the same medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good was substituted for the one nominated in the order.
The number of times this order has been dispensed. The sum of this number minus one and the remaining repeats provides the number of repeats on the original order.
The category of reimbursement or subsidy sought for the item.
A new instruction with changed dose or timing has been created that replaces this one.
The expiry date of the medicine administered as documented by the manufacturer.
The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.
The medication has been recommended, generally from one clinician to another, where the latter has the responsibility to order/authorise the medication.
Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.
The datetime at which the action was scheduled to occur.
*Details of use, administration, dispensing or other care step relating to a medicine, vaccine or other therapeutic good which may arise from an instruction from a clinician.(en)
*The medication is planned but no execution has taken place.(en)
*The instruction has issued as an item on a prescription.(en)
*The medication has been taken by the patient for the first time.(en)
*A single administration of the medication has taken place.(en)
*The medication has been completed as instructed.(en)
*The medication has not been dispensed as supply is not yet available.(en)
*The administration of the medication has been suspended.(en)
*The medication has been re-prescribed for an existing instruction.(en)
*Reissuing of this prescription is not available without some intervention.(en)
*The planned administration has been cancelled prior to any administration.(en)
*The plan to order medication has been suspended.(en)
*The prescription has been cancelled but administration or dispensing may have occurred.(en)
*The administration of this medication has been ceased before anticipated completion.(en)
*The time to start this medication has been set.(en)
Zdravilo, ki je bilo zadrano in ni bilo dano pacientu
Zdravilo, ki ni bilo dano pacientu zato, ker ga je pacient zavrnil
Ime osebe, komu je zdravilo razdeljeno
tevilo ponovnih izdaj zdravila za katere ni potrebno imeti dodatnega naroila. Te informacije lahko zahteva pacient ali predpisovalec zdravila.
Povrnjeno izdano zdravilo, ki ni bilo uporabljeno
Druga znamka zdravila z enakim uinkom
tevilo izdaj zdravila. Vsota tega tevila in tevila ponovitev izdaj predstavlja izdano koliino originalnega naroila.
*A new instruction with changed dose or timing has been created that replaces this one.(en)
*The expiry date of the medicine administered as documented by the manufacturer.(en)
*The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.(en)
* Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.(en)
*The datetime at which the action was scheduled to occur.(en)
The actual ingredients with strength and overall form of a chemical or medication.
Detailed Information about an individual ingredient.
The name of the chemical or medication.
The detailed chemical name of the compound that is an active ingredient.
The role of the agent. If not stated it will be assumed to be therapeutic.
The chemical has a known and desired effect which is positive.
This chemical is toxic and has no therapeutic effect.
The chemical is active but aids the therapeutic effect of another ingredient.
The chemical has another active role.
The formulation or presentation of the overall substance.
The ingredient is present to prolong the life of the substance.
The ingredient is used to colour the substance.
The strength of an individual ingredient
*The actual ingredients with strength and overall form of a chemical or medication.(en)
*The name of the chemical or medication.(en)
*The detailed chemical name of the compound that is an active ingredient.(en)
*The role of the agent. If not stated it will be assumed to be therapeutic.(en)
*The chemical has a known and desired effect which is positive.(en)
*This chemical is toxic and has no therapeutic effect.(en)
*The chemical is active but aids the therapeutic effect of another ingredient.(en)
*The formulation or presentation of the overall substance.(en)
*The ingredient is present to prolong the life of the substance.(en)
*The ingredient is used to colour the substance.(en)
Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.
Tags applied to the composition. They can contain various ids, such as episode id, central case id or other types of information forming composition meta-data.
*Tags applied to the composition. They can contain various ids, such as episode id, central case id or other types of information forming composition meta-data.(en)
